intro: Sida brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petioled sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Sida brachypetala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
